You are configuring Dynamics 365 Sales for a US-based company as follows:
✑ Utah to California is the West territory
✑ Illinois to Colorado is the Central territory.
✑ Maine to Indiana is the East territory.
The company wants the territories set up as follows:
✑ Salespersons 1 and 2 sell in the West territory.
✑ Salespersons 5 and 6 sell in the Central territory.
✑ Salespersons 3 and 4 sell in the East territory.
✑ Postal code for each state used as the location.
You need to set up the territories.
Solution:
✑ Create the West territory and add the manager.
✑ Add members and save.
Repeat for the Central and East territories.
//IMG//

Does the solution meet the goal?

discussion.content:
✑ Create the West territory and add the manager.
✑ Add members and save.
✑ Repeat for the Central and East territories.
Missing fourth step: Relate each territory to the postal code(s)

questions.question_text:
You create a playbook template. You enable the progress tracking option for opportunities. The template consists of one task, one phone call, and one note.

A salesperson adds the template to an opportunity and adds an email to the playbook activities.

The salesperson reports that the count displayed in the Total Activities field does not update.

You need to resolve the issue.

What should you do?

discussion.content:
email can not be added to a Playbook template, only Tasks, Phone call and appointment can be. So D is not an option for sure. 
Another option is - after you add email activity to the Playbook, make any update to any of the other activities, that will trigger recalculation and start counting the email also in total activities. Unfortunately this is not an option in answer, so C seems to be most feasible solution.

I think the answer is D 
as the template doesn't contain email so needs to be added to calc right

comments.content: email can not be added to a Playbook template, only Tasks, Phone call and appointment can be.

choices.B: Ask the salesperson to save and refresh the playbook window.
choices.D: Add the email to the playbook template.
choices.C: Create a custom rollup field on the playbook entity.
choices.A: Create a calculated field on the playbook template entity.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

A company is implementing Power BI templates for Dynamics 365 Sales.

The company wants to use prebuilt dashboards.

You need to identify the steps to configure the Power BI templates.

Which four actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.

//IMG//

discussion.content: Why not used in both - create real-time workflow?
Since there is no customization the answer needs to be Child Work Flow for both the cases.

Given answer are correct-
1 - The real time workflow will create a Lead and an email 
2 - The child workflow will send that email to Marketing Manager

Since a real-time workflow is already created and links the lead to the email received.
We create a child workflow with two steps:
1- Create email
2- Send email

Now we update the real-time workflow and call the child workflow responsible for sending email to the marketing manager.
Real time is already set up as the trigger in the lead creation. Create an email and send it are both child flows from the first one.

comments.content: Well, it states that the lead is created by a (business) rule. To fulfil with the next requirement "create an email" you would need a real time workflow.

discussion.content: Create a Child workflow for both.

comments.content: Because a business process flow is a different type of flow to orchestrate the actions of a process such as "Lead to Deal" or "Case to Resolution".

discussion.content: Why it is not a BPF instead of a real time work flow?
